brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators designed a study to determine whether target-controlled infusion
      (Propofol) or Inhaled anaesthetic (Sevoflurane)  would provide same postoperative sleep
      quality in patients undergoing thyroidectomy.

clinical_study.brief_title: Postoperative Sleep Quality of Patients Anesthesia With Propofol or Sevoflurane Undergoing Thyroidectomy

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigators designed a study to determine whether target-controlled infusion
      (Propofol) or Inhaled anaesthetic (Sevoflurane) would provide same postoperative sleep
      quality in patients undergoing thyroidectomy.The bispectral index score (BIS) was monitored
      during the operation and the first postoperative night.The sleep quality will be test with
      Pittsburgh sleep quality index (PSQI) and Postoperative sleep quality index of China Medical
      University (PSQI-CMU)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Participants were deemed eligible if they were candidates for spinal anesthesia
             undergoing thyroidectomy

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Existing cognitive impairment as evidenced by Mini-Mental State Examination scores
             below 24 (of the 30 possible points)

          -  A history of neurological and psychiatric diseases including stroke, and psychosis

          -  Severe visual or hearing impairment

          -  Unwillingness to comply with the protocol or procedures

facility.name: the First Hospital of China Medical University

clinical_study.official_title: Postoperative Sleep Quality of Patients Anesthesia With Target-controlled Infusion (Propofol) or Inhaled Anaesthetic (Sevoflurane) Undergoing Thyroidectomy

other_outcome.description: Postoperative delirium was tested with CAM-ICU 3 days after surgery

primary_outcome.description: All patients underwent baseline Pittsburgh sleep quality index (PSQI) were assessed one day before operation, postoperative first and second night. The PSQI-CMU were assessed postoperative first and second night.The primary outcome measure are change of PSQI and PSQI-CMU.
primary_outcome.measure: The Change of postoperative sleep quality
primary_outcome.time_frame: preoperation, first and second postoperative night

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The blood samples were collected before induction of anesthesia and 3 days after the end of surgery.
secondary_outcome.measure: The change of interleukin-6 level in plasma samples
secondary_outcome.time_frame: preoperation and the third postoperative day

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver), Primary Purpose: Treatment
